physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild dysmorphic facial features (frontal bossing, posteriorly rotated low-set ears with underdeveloped superior helix and tragus, mild hyper-telorism, depressed and broad nasal bridge), shortened neck, posterior white hair lock, small bell-shaped thoracic cavity with wide-spaced nipples, rhizomelic limbs, and mild fifth finger clinodactyly. Testes were descended with normal volume bilaterally (2.5 mL).
MRI shows a heterogeneously enhancing mass arising from the sella with suprasellar extension measuring 8.1 x 37.5 x 10.7 mm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Interval increase in size of the tumor to 9.0 x 31.0 x 12.0 mm at 3.5 months of age.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal thyroid tests. Serial cortisol within normal limits, robust cortisol of 25 mg/dL (690 nmol/L) at 7 weeks of life.
Tumor mass grown to 12.5 x 12.5 x 15.1 mm with abutment onto the optic chiasm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tumor grew from previous measurement at this stage.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Post surgical intervention hormone levels sharply decreased.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual increase in IGF-1, PRL, and GH concentrations observed post-operatively.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Measured in the 99th percentile for height (12.26 SD) and weight (12.52 SD). MRI shows 7.0 x 35.0 x 36.0 mm area of hypointensity suggestive of possible residual disease.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in height z score since the last measurement; evidence of possible tumor regrowth.
